abstract: Jonathan Mak, university student in Hong Kong, became Internet sensation after producing silhouetted profile of Steven Jobs following his death; was quickly derided and denounced after it came to light that image closely resembled one produced earlier in year by British graphic artist Chris Thornley.
snippet: A Hong Kong student went from being an unknown graphic designer to an Internet sensation before becoming the object of derision over an image of Steve Jobs that he produced.
lead_paragraph: A Hong Kong student went from being an unknown graphic designer to an Internet sensation before becoming the object of derision over an image of Steve Jobs that he produced.

headline.main: Artists’ Logos Show Reach and Hostility of the Web
headline.print_headline: Artists’ Logos Shows Reach And Hostility Of the Web
headline.seo: Apple Logos Show Reach and Hostility of the Web
